commits.message:
EUCA-11147 Eucanetd files can fill up /tmp in non-EDGE modes

Problem Description: Eucanetd can create various temporary files in /tmp. If there are errors this can
                     lead to /tmp getting filled with thousands of zero lenght temp files.

Changes:
 - Added removal of associated ipt/ebt/ips files in lni_free() method, so that the files will get
   removed on process shutdown.
 - Changed the ipt/ips/ebt handler init functions to re-use the temporary name initially created via
   mkstemp(), and truncate the file(s) when the associated *_handler_init() method is called.
 - Added helper method truncate_file, which truncates the file and closes the fd automatically.
 - Make lni_init happen after daemonize of process

Testing:
 - QA regression tests
 - Manual verification that the files are removed.
 - Manual examination of log files to verify the filename is being reused.
